dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The capacity to experience such visions of the past had always seemed to me to be a most desirable talent, but I see now that it is as much a burden as a blessing.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Sorry about that... I let my emotions get the better of me. It's just that she and I are of an age, and we're neither of us one thing or another... I can't help but feel like she's my problem to solve.

dialogue.name: CAMPGUARD
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I don't know that we solved anything exactly, but we've given Fordola something to think about at least.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Aye... And I've found something new to think about too.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I don't know about you, Forename, but the visions only come to me every now and then. From the way Fordola kept wincing, though, I get the feeling she's having them almost all the time. That's a lot of bad memories to deal with...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmmm... I wonder... Could there be some fundamental difference between one who is born with the Echo and one who has been artificially imbued with it?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well, the Immortal Flames have been scouring that research facility ever since the liberation. There's a chance they might have some answers for us.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: General Aldynn's there overseeing the investigation. Let's go and pay him a visit, shall we?

dialogue.name: RESONATORIUMGUARD
dialogue.text: General Aldynn is inside, aye. Will you be joining him?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Enter the Resonatorium?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Seeing this facility, I am reminded of what they did to Krile...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Eurgh... They should burn this place to the ground and be done with it...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Come on, let's talk to Raubahn.

dialogue.name: RESONATORIUMGUARD
dialogue.text: Will you be going inside, misssir?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: What news? You spoke with Fordola, I take it?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Yes. As expected, she didn't say very much, but it wasn't a total waste of time. Arenvald noticed something odd about her. He thinks she might be having visions almost constantly, which is not how the Echo normally works. Have you found anything here which might explain why it's so different for her?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Hmph. We've been hard-pressed just to organize the research materials, let alone study them. To be frank, I'd welcome the Scions' expert assistance, if you have time to lend a hand.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: For a race with no innate capacity to manipulate aether, the Garleans have conducted some exceedingly elaborate aetheric experiments...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: These bastards would fiddle with a man's very soul if it served their purpose. Nothing is sacred to them. Nothing.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Leave this section to me.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Bring whatever you discover to me, and I'll put all our findings together.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSENGINEER
dialogue.text: We received a request from the Alliance to analyze these devices, and I've been recording everything of interest.

dialogue.name: FLAMEDOCTOR
dialogue.text: So many bodies...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The device in which Krile was held seems even more ominous now you know its purpose. The surrounding pods are marked “Supply Subject” while this one bears the label “Master Subject.”

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSENGINEER
dialogue.text: The Ironworks received a request from the Alliance to analyze these devices, and I've been recording everything of interest. Did you notice the labeling?

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSENGINEER
dialogue.text: All the pods are designed to drain the aether of the occupant...save that one right there.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSENGINEER
dialogue.text: Unlike the others, the interior's been fitted with an array of sensors to measure aetheric wave forms. To what purpose, however, I couldn't tell you.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSENGINEER
dialogue.text: All the pods are designed to drain the aether of the occupant...save that one right there.

dialogue.name: IRONWORKSENGINEER
dialogue.text: Unlike the others, the interior's been fitted with an array of sensors to measure aetheric wave forms. To what purpose, however, I couldn't tell you.

dialogue.name: FLAMEDOCTOR
dialogue.text: So many bodies... Every one of them a victim of these “experiments.”

dialogue.name: FLAMEDOCTOR
dialogue.text: Few show any signs of external injury. From what we've been able to determine, they perished from forcible aether extraction. Such a miserable way to die...

dialogue.name: FLAMEDOCTOR
dialogue.text: We've recovered scores of bodies from those devices. What could possibly justify the deaths of so many...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
“Idle conversation prohibited.
Eating and drinking prohi─”
The fallen scrap of parchment appears to list facility regulations, but nothing of any interest.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I know little and less of science, so any light you can shed on this facility's operations would be much appreciated. Forename, shall we start with you?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Taken in combination with the testimonies of Krile and Thancred, I do begin to see exactly what the imperials were attempting here.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The enhancement procedure entailed infusing a single candidate with aether siphoned from a multitude of “supply subjects.”

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As for the “master subject”─in this case, Krile─the patterns of her aetheric activity would provide the model upon which they would artificially engineer the candidate's aura.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: ...In other words, they were trying to recreate Krile's Echo?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I believe so─which would explain our prisoner's present state. Krile is possessed of an unrivaled ability to hear the whispers of the soul, and it seems probable that the procedure engendered the same acute sensitivity in Fordola.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: The soldiers who guard Fordola...many of them lost friends and family to the Skulls.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: And there's a sentry at her door, night and day. If she can't help sensing their thoughts and seeing their past─

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: But you don't just see their past─you live it. All the emotions; all the pain. Imagine what it'd do to you. You'd never be the same again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Indeed. As you may recall, Ysayle was completely transformed by a single glimpse of Hraesvelgr's past.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Fordola has been forced to experience the agony of those whose lives she destroyed. The guilt must be unbearable.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: That explains her request to be executed...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Sounds to me like a kind of justice. Regardless, she can suffer on for now. We have more pressing matters to consider.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: If the results of these experiments have been relayed back to Garlemald, there will be naught to stop the Empire from repeating the trick. They could give the Echo to anyone─to an entire legion.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We must be ready. We must learn all we can of these godsforsaken procedures─and Fordola remains our best source of information. She'll not be getting her wish. Not yet.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Right...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Keep faith, lass. If you're to convince others to follow you, you must believe what you're telling them. People will respond to passion─but not if it's feigned.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I understand. Thank you, General.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We should leave the Flames to it. Let's go.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The forcible extraction of aether from a living subject is invariably fatal. How many died that Fordola might gain her new abilities?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I've never known why I was given the Echo...but this makes me want to put it to good use.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: <sigh> I go looking for answers about the Echo, and end up getting schooled by Raubahn. Yet more evidence that I don't know what I'm doing. It's no wonder people listen to him and not me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: General Aldynn is a veteran of countless campaigns, Lyse. You cannot compare yourself to a commander of his experience.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I know. But I also know that I couldn't have convinced that mob to give up and go home. It makes me realize how much we rely on his authority...and how much I still have to learn.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I wonder what he'll do when everything here is settled... I mean, it's his homeland. After going to the trouble of winning it back, might he not want to stay?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis a quandary which countless refugees now face: to continue the life they built in Ul'dah, or start again in the land of their birth...

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Forename! A moment!

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: I am newly returned from Ul'dah, with a message from the sultana.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Her Grace desires an audience with you. She understands that you have responsibilities here, but asks that you visit the palace at your earliest convenience.

dialogue.name: PIPIN
dialogue.text: Well, I must away and attend to other business. Until next time, my friends!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: An audience with the sultana! Depending on the nature of her consultation, this might be the perfect opportunity to inquire about the General's future plans.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Yes, we'd all like to know about those, Alphinaud─but not everyone's as comfortable interrogating royalty as you. Take no notice of him, Forename.
